Tests package¶

Tests folder that provides code coverage

1.tests.cluster_model module¶

tests.cluster_model.PosEncoder(cluster_centers, lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2)[source]¶

Returns feature vector based on latitude & longitude By calculating distance btw the location and hotspots predicated from the original dataset.

Parameters

  • cluster_centers (list of floats) – the hotspots predicated from the original dataset.

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

tests.cluster_model.dateEncoder(month_enc, month)[source]¶

Returns encoded features based on month

Parameters

  • month_enc (sklearn encoder) – the encodings for month

  • month (float/int) – the month of the year

tests.cluster_model.geo_model(model, model_features)[source]¶

Returns probability of wildfire, given a model and its features

Parameters

  • model (sklearn model) – the model used for the prediction

  • model_features (float (ranging from 0 to 1)) – the contex rich features generated for predication

tests.cluster_model.get_countyInfo(county_coordinates, lat, lon)[source]¶

Returns best match county name for given latitude & longitude

Parameters

  • county_coordinates (dictionary of county as keys and co-ordinates as values) – the county wise co-ordinates

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

tests.cluster_model.get_countyLocations()[source]¶

Returns latitudes & longitudes for each county

tests.cluster_model.get_encodings(all_data)[source]¶

Returns encodings for non-numerical data

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

tests.cluster_model.get_extreames_positionalInfo(cluster_centers, all_data)[source]¶

Returns Returns min & max values for data normalization of positional data

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

tests.cluster_model.get_extreames_weatherInfo(all_data)[source]¶

Returns Returns min & max values for data normalization of weather data

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

tests.cluster_model.get_hotspots(all_data)[source]¶

Returns hotspots centers which have high probability of wildfire occurunce

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

tests.cluster_model.get_weatherInfo(all_data, county_coordinates, lat, lon, month)[source]¶

Returns weather information for the sample

Parameters

  • all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

  • county_coordinates (dictionary of county as keys and co-ordinates as values) – the county wise co-ordinates

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

tests.cluster_model.make_features(all_data)[source]¶

Returns processed feature and information required from the cleaned data for model training

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

tests.cluster_model.make_sample_features(all_data, encodings, extreames, weather_data, lat, lon, month)[source]¶

Returns feature required for wildfire predication

Parameters

  • all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

  • encodings (sklearn encodigs) – the month encodings

  • extreames (list of float) – the minimum and maximum values needed for data normalization

  • weather_data (list of floats) – the weather data like temp, humidity, wind speed needed for predication

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (string) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

tests.cluster_model.model_init()[source]¶

Initailizes model training and saves processed information for model evalutaion

tests.cluster_model.pred_func_geo(all_data, county_coordinates, model, encodings, extreames, lat, lon, month)[source]¶

Wrapper function that, Returns probability of safety from wildfire incidents given latitude, longitude and month of the year

Parameters

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

4. tests.test_model module¶

tests.test_model.test_county_prediction()[source]¶

test the prediction result from the county take all the data before 2020 for training and take the data from 2020 for testing the result is shown in mean absolute deviation and confusion matrix (happen or not)
